api/services.title: Services API Reference
api/services.description: This document describes all available services in Fluttron and their APIs.

architecture/bridge-communication.title: Bridge Communication
architecture/bridge-communication.description: Bridge communication is the IPC mechanism between Host and Renderer using JavaScript Handlers.

architecture/host-layer.title: Host Layer
architecture/host-layer.description: The Host layer is a Flutter Desktop application that provides native capabilities and manages the application lifecycle.

architecture/overview.title: Architecture Overview
architecture/overview.description: Fluttron adopts a dual-layer architecture similar to Electron or mini-program containers, combining the stability of native host applications with the flexibility of web rendering.

architecture/renderer-layer.title: Renderer Layer
architecture/renderer-layer.description: The Renderer layer is a Flutter Web application running in WebView, responsible for UI rendering and business logic.

examples/hello-world.title: Hello World Example
examples/hello-world.description: This is a complete Hello World example demonstrating the basic Fluttron setup and communication between Host and Renderer.

getting-started/installation.title: Installation
getting-started/installation.description: This guide will help you install and set up Fluttron on your development machine.

getting-started/project-structure.title: Project Structure
getting-started/project-structure.description: Fluttron is organized as a monorepo with three main packages. Each package serves a specific purpose in the architecture.

getting-started/quick-start.title: Quick Start
getting-started/quick-start.description: This guide will help you create and run your first Fluttron application in minutes.

intro.title: intro
intro.description: Welcome to Fluttron, the Dart-native cross-platform container OS.
